subject: Re: How to test private member variables?
msgSnippet: ... But that s core to what a mock is and how it is used: set it up, use it, ask it to verify. Dave
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Neil Swingler" <neil@n...> wrote:
> > >So said Dave Astels on 2003-07-25 --------------------
> > >--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Peter Morgan <pmorgan@j...> wrote:
> > >> On Thu, 2003-07-24 at 19:15, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> > >> I much prefer to query the mock object and assert whether the
> > >> 'correct' thing happened in the unit test.
> > >
> > >Hmm.. not very object opriented. Why not tell the mock what to
> > >expect, and let it figure out if it happened?
> >
>
>
> The problem with putting the assert in the mock is that if the mock
> never gets called, the assert doesn't happen and the test still
> passes.

But that's core to what a mock is and how it is used: set it up, use
it, ask it to verify.

Dave
